npcLines: (Lin holds the Biomass Reactor. It hums faintly, a promise of power, a beacon of hope... or a catalyst for war.)
Thought (Self): This changes things. Dr. Reyes and the FRN want it to rebuild... but what about the others? What about *my* own interests?

playerChoices.text: Deliver the reactor to Dr. Reyes and the FRN as promised.
The Followers of Apocalypse's Kindle could use this. Their vision of the future is... compelling.
Perhaps the CalGuard remnants could secure it and prevent misuse.
This reactor... it's too powerful for any one faction right now. I need to hold onto it, for now.
I need more information before I decide. (Postpone decision)

npcLines: Thought (Self): Reyes is idealistic, but the FRN has resources. This could genuinely help Fallbrook recover, if they can be trusted to use it wisely.

playerChoices.text: (Confirm) The FRN it is. Let's hope they're ready for this.

npcLines: Thought (Self): Agustus spoke of a new dawn, powered by a purified ideal. This reactor could be the heart of their new world. But their methods... are extreme.

playerChoices.text: (Confirm) The FOAK will receive the reactor. May their new sun rise swiftly.

npcLines: Thought (Self): Sandy Adegoke and the CalGuard remnants value order and control above all. They'd secure it, no doubt. But would they ever share its benefits?

playerChoices.text: (Confirm) The CalGuard are the most disciplined option. It goes to them.

npcLines: Thought (Self): No one in Fallbrook can be trusted with this much power right now. Not the FPD, not the FRN, and certainly not any of the fringe factions. For now, it stays with me. I'll find the right time, the right place... or the right price.

playerChoices.text: (Confirm) This burden is mine to carry, for now.
